My Story

WHO AM I? My name is Victor Amatta ChukwuEbuka, and I am from Anambra State, Nigeria. I was born into a very poor family, with my mother solely responsible for raising me and my four siblings, though we lost one to cancer. Growing up, I worked for a Real Estate firm as a cleaner. At that time, Network Marketing was, and still is, widely regarded as a Ponzi scheme or a pyramid scheme, with many fraud cases tarnishing the image of the industry. Only a few legitimate Network Marketing companies exist today in Nigeria. The term "Network Marketing" turns many people away because of misconceptions, such as the belief that you only earn money by bringing in two people, along with other false narratives that persist to this day. I used to be one of the people who believed that Network Marketing doesn‚Äôt work. However, I have since come to realize that the world‚Äôs top billionaires share one common trait: LEVERAGING. From businesspeople and politicians to footballers and musicians, all of them are involved in leveraging. Network Marketing is simply about helping others succeed. It's about personal development. Don‚Äôt be afraid of wealth; embrace it. To everyone reading this, you have the potential to reach heights you never thought possible. All you need is to believe and embrace the opportunities in front of you. Beautiful things can and will happen to you.
